key_points: Chris Cuomo addressed his involvement in advising his brother, Andrew Cuomo, during the latter's sexual harassment scandal.
Chris Cuomo returned to CNN and discussed hopes for a better outcome for everyone involved, despite refraining from covering his brother's scandal due to conflict of interest.
Chris acknowledged advising Andrew Cuomo to own his actions and be contrite, insisting he never attempted to control CNN's coverage of the scandal.
CNN has been criticized for not being transparent or consistent in handling Chris Cuomo's conflict of interest regarding his brother's scandal.
Chris Cuomo's actions have been condemned by various media critics, calling for his suspension and an investigation into his role.
CNN issued a statement in May criticizing Chris Cuomo's engagement in conversations that included members of the Governor's staff, deeming it inappropriate.
Chris Cuomo explained that CNN's rules prevented him from covering the scandal on his show.
Expert opinions suggest Chris Cuomo's credibility and CNN's handling of the situation raise significant ethical concerns.
CNN has defended the Cuomo brothers' pandemic discussions as fitting due to the extraordinary circumstances of the pandemic.
Critics argue that Chris Cuomo's involvement has tarnished the credibility of journalism and shown a problematic closeness to the powerful.
spokespersons: Kathleen Bartzen Culver (Director, Center for Journalism Ethics and Professor, University of Wisconsin-Madison)
Erik Wemple (Media Critic, The Washington Post)
Margaret Sullivan (Media Columnist, The Washington Post)
Robert Thompson (Founding Director, Bleier Center for Television and Popular Culture, Syracuse University)
